intro: Lotononis curtii, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, bell-shaped blooms that attract pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
